Hi CD, How does feeding notes into a turret work this year? Is it just compressing it into a line and then forcing it through into the turret?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":62,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T13:07:31.643Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":1763,"readers_count":1762,"score":707.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":462385,"topic_slug":"turrets-in-2024","display_username":"Matt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63625,"username":"ChiefK33f","name":"Keith Farelle Cozart","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a3d4f5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":23}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31765,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/turrets-in-2024/462385/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":22},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":26,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3359951,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T14:27:16.076Z","cooked":"

A lot of teams hand off to the shooter from the intake, choosing not to put it through a turret ring.

254 is massively the exception in this case.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":62,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T14:27:16.076Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":1711,"readers_count":1710,"score":527.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":462385,"topic_slug":"turrets-in-2024","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/turrets-in-2024/462385/5","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10},{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":13,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3360027,"name":"Zach","username":"ZCam_4415","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zcam_4415/{size}/197852_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T15:38:47.036Z","cooked":"

can anyone explain how this was driven? is it multiple motors?

Also to the OP, we had a turret this year. we would intake a note from the ground and it would transfer into our shooter “carriage” (the holding place for the note) from the intake, and we could then aim the turret around only after we had the note.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":62,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T15:38:47.036Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":1650,"readers_count":1649,"score":390.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":462385,"topic_slug":"turrets-in-2024","display_username":"Zach","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63625,"username":"ChiefK33f","name":"Keith Farelle Cozart","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a3d4f5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58913,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4415 Leader"},"post_url":"/t/turrets-in-2024/462385/6","custom_user_title":"4415 Leader","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3360143,"name":null,"username":"2930notjorde","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/2930notjorde/{size}/246278_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T17:24:30.180Z","cooked":"

Another key exception is 2910. In my (somewhat uneducated) opinion the main benefit to a turret in 2024, which is flexibility with autos, requires the ability to serialize at any turret/drivebase angle, an aspect where 2910/254’s architecture shines. Otherwise since only 1 game piece can be held and full field cycles are usually required, turrets seem to just be a cool novelty in most cases.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":62,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T17:24:45.735Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":1590,"readers_count":1589,"score":368.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":462385,"topic_slug":"turrets-in-2024","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57739,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2930 Alumnus; Big Sky Robotics Ri3D Club President"},"post_url":"/t/turrets-in-2024/462385/7","custom_user_title":"2930 Alumnus; Big Sky Robotics Ri3D Club President","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3360147,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T17:27:33.074Z","cooked":"

If you are expecting to be a team that is plauged with defense, turrets also make a lot of sense, especially if located high up on the bot, above most defenders.

2767 designed the 2022 machine with the defense constraint in mind. It wasn’t as bad as we thought, but still handy. It also allowed for the traversal rung shot into the hub (ultimately a novelty, but still fun).

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":62,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T17:28:32.891Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":1528,"readers_count":1527,"score":360.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":462385,"topic_slug":"turrets-in-2024","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57739,"username":"2930notjorde","name":null,"avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/2930notjorde/{size}/246278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/turrets-in-2024/462385/8","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3360152,"name":null,"username":"2930notjorde","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/2930notjorde/{size}/246278_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T17:31:30.644Z","cooked":"

Locating a turret high up on a bot for this game in particular is also a design tradeoff regarding defense since you’re likely sacrificing the ability to drive beneath the stage. I will agree that if a team can make its turret control rigid and precise enough, though, it can make the bot resistant to “bumps” from defense throwing off aim (since the alignment of the drive base no longer matters). Whether this is worth it is ultimately up to teams to decide.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":62,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T17:31:30.644Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":1485,"readers_count":1484,"score":372.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":462385,"topic_slug":"turrets-in-2024","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57739,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2930 Alumnus; Big Sky Robotics Ri3D Club President"},"post_url":"/t/turrets-in-2024/462385/9","custom_user_title":"2930 Alumnus; Big Sky Robotics Ri3D Club President","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3360158,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T17:34:34.667Z","cooked":"

I think this year the tradeoff isn’t worth it, but placing the turret near max height to go under the stage is the right call (winces with 2020 st joe energy) .

Then some driver practice to keep a defender on the corner of the robot (maximize seperation between the two bots) .

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":62,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T17:38:36.051Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":1485,"readers_count":1484,"score":452.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":462385,"topic_slug":"turrets-in-2024","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://youtu.be/s6IbjqI-GRc?si=nGpAa9X4oqaCcQDb&t=93","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":36}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57739,"username":"2930notjorde","name":null,"avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/2930notjorde/{size}/246278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/turrets-in-2024/462385/10","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3360162,"name":"Dave Ebersol","username":"Dave_Ebersol","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dave_ebersol/{size}/238635_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T17:36:21.142Z","cooked":"

Our team decided to put both the shooter and intake on one single mechanism and have that assembly move on a turret. This would allow the game piece to travel through the center of the robot.

image930×641 230 KB

image988×556 119 KB

image976×775 117 KB

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":62,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T17:37:13.831Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":26,"reads":1507,"readers_count":1506,"score":776.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":462385,"topic_slug":"turrets-in-2024","display_username":"Dave Ebersol","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/d/a/da54e78ceeec3c60cb037e4b2c6cf5ae34d521f8.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/b/1/b126d66200813e964c3b0e18def9bcabc40da957.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/c/0/c065f5c44cb3ecc0a4acefd7f54b1631b81eab09.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":23}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27013,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/turrets-in-2024/462385/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":23}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":23,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3360167,"name":null,"username":"2930notjorde","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/2930notjorde/{size}/246278_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T17:40:08.105Z","cooked":"

Regardless of the inevitable “to turret, or not to turret” discussion, I think we can all agree that turret envy is real. Teams that manage to do them well and make them consistent, rigid, and truly helpful for accomplishing game actions always make me want one…

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":62,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T17:40:08.105Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":1496,"readers_count":1495,"score":424.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":462385,"topic_slug":"turrets-in-2024","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57739,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2930 Alumnus; Big Sky Robotics Ri3D Club President"},"post_url":"/t/turrets-in-2024/462385/12","custom_user_title":"2930 Alumnus; Big Sky Robotics Ri3D Club President","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3360181,"name":"Andrew Torrance","username":"Torrance","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/torrance/{size}/152754_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T17:51:10.981Z","cooked":"

Here’s some teasers from the Tech Binder / Pit Display we’ll have at Champs:

image1167×1322 113 KB

image1171×1300 101 KB

The design allows Notes to be fed into Shooter or exhausted out to Amplifier (Amp/Trap scoring elevator) from any Turret position.

I will find out for sure next Tuesday at the Robonauts Open House, but based on the reveal video I have a theory. I think the note is fed straight upwards from below by a set of top/bottom rollers (similar to most shooters). There is then a second set of top/bottom rollers on the shooter side of the turret that rotates with the shooter. Best case scenario is they are parallel to each other and the note transfers between these sets of rollers like any other robot. Worst case scenario, they are perpendicular to each other. Since the shooter set of rollers is constantly spinning in, the note will twist to fit itself inside of the top set of rollers. It is also possible they have code to avoid the worst case scenario in case that doesn’t work.

If you watch the reveal video, the note clearly twists as it goes from the intake side to the shooter side.

I mean, it is called Twister for a reason

It’s about 8" between the outside of the Feeder wheels and the inside of the polycarb wall. The Note is basically rolling against the outer wall like a ball in a radial ball bearing.

Here’s what our prototype on January 13th looked like: a big baseplate with holes so we could vary the overall diameter / how much we compress the disk:

We have occasionally had some Notes break, usually due to a speed mismatch between the Intake and the Feeder. Since EBR we have made the rolling surfaces be more speed matched in software so I don’t think we broke any Notes in the past 3 weeks.
